sections.doc:
## Introduction

  An accordion provides a way for viewers to have a glance at the outline of the content and jump to a section or their choice at their will.

sections.doc: Each of the `amp-accordion` component’s immediate children is considered a section in the accordion. Each of these nodes must be a `<section>` tag. Each `<section>` must contain only two direct children. The first child (of the section) will be considered as the heading of the section. Clicking/tapping on this section will trigger the expand/collapse behaviour. Use the `disable-session-states` attribute to disable preserving the accordion state across a session.

sections.doc: The `expand-single-section` attribute forces the accordion to only allow one expanded section at any given time. Expanding one section will cause any other open sections to close.
